unnormalised: Organic farming holds immense promise for sustainable agriculture in India. Studies by ICAR have shown improved soil health in regions like Kerala. While yields might initially be lower compared to conventional methods, the long-term benefits for biodiversity and reduced input costs (Rs. 5,000/acre est.) are significant. Perhaps a focus on traditional knowledge, like incorporating practices used during Onam festivities in preparing the land, can further boost organic adoption. This will help with a healthier biryani!
